page.title: 17EGGINTON WELL DRESSING
page.content: We have well dressings to ask God to keep the wells full of water in limestone country. Nowadays we have them to make money for charity. Well dressings have been going on for four years in Egginton. There are eight wells in Etwall and they are all dressed. They are made with large boards that have been soaked in the brook for a week. They are coated with a mixture of clay, sand and water.A picture is drawn by school children. The design is marked out in alder cones on the clay, then flower petals and other natural materials are pressed into the clay. It takes a week to mark out and petal. The completed boards that are 2m. square may take six men to lift them. The boards are stood up against the well in Etwall. Corinne Bailey & John Dunkerley
